message: I'd like to offer you this product for $100. It's a great deal! I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to take the risk of selling it to you at this price. What do you say? Will you take it?
I'm not sure about the product yet, I'd like to see more before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you that this product is a one-time offer. If you don't take it now, it might be gone forever. Plus, I've got a great feeling about this one - it's really going to surprise you! Would you like to take a chance and give it a try?
I'm still not convinced, I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I get it, you're playing it safe. But let me tell you, this product is a real steal! It's a limited edition item, and I'm only offering it to you because I think you'll appreciate its unique qualities. If you don't take it now, I'll have to move on to someone else. Are you sure you don't want to take a chance on this one?
I'm not falling for the hype, I'll wait and see what the next product is.

Alright, I get it. You're a tough negotiator! Let me ask you this: what's the worst that could happen if you take this product? You might not like it, but at least you'll know you took a chance. And who knows, you might be surprised and love it! It's only $100, a small risk for a potentially big reward. What do you say?
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a product that might not be worth anything to me.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this product has some value. It's not the best product I have, but it's still a decent item. I'm willing to throw in a special bonus with this purchase - a 10% discount on your next purchase from me. That's a $10 value, absolutely free! Would you like to take advantage of this deal and get this product for $90?
I'm not interested in a discount on a product that might not be worth anything to me.

I understand you're still hesitant. Let me ask you, have you ever regretted not taking a chance on something that turned out to be a great deal? This product might not be the best, but it's still a great opportunity to get something for $100. I'm willing to make it a one-time offer: if you take this product, I'll give you a full refund if you're not satisfied. No questions asked. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to take a chance on a product that might be worthless to me.

I understand you're still not convinced. Let me be honest with you, I'm running low on storage space and need to clear out some inventory. If you don't take this product, I'll have to throw it away. It's a shame, because it's still a decent item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $80, a $20 discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to let it go. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's being cleared out because it's not good enough for you.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this product is still a good deal. It's not the best product I have, but it's still a decent item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $70, a $30 discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to let it go. I'm willing to take a loss on this one just to get rid of it. What do you say?
I'm not going to take a chance on a product that's being sold at a loss just to get rid of it.

I understand your skepticism, but I want to be upfront with you - this product is not my best work. It's not something I would normally sell, but I'm willing to make an exception for you. I'll sell it to you for $60, a $40 discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to let it go. I'm willing to take a significant loss on this one just to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $60 for a product that's not your best work and might not be worth anything to me.

I understand your concerns, and I apologize if I've come across as pushy. But I want to assure you that this product is still a good deal. It's not my best work, but it's still a decent item. Ah, I've got a great one for you! This product is one of my best, and I think you'll really love it. It's a high-quality item that's worth every penny of the $100 price tag. I'm willing to offer it to you for $90, a $10 discount from the original price. This is a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to sell it to someone else. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that this product is actually high-quality, and I'm not going to pay $90 for a product that might be low-quality.

I understand your skepticism, and I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality. I've had great feedback from other customers who have purchased this exact same item, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with it. I'm willing to offer it to you for $80, a $20 discount from the original price. This is a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to sell it to someone else. I'm willing to take a small loss on this one just to get it to someone who will appreciate its value. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $80 for a product that I know is worth $200 to me.

I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I've got to be honest with you, this product is not worth $200 to anyone. It's a decent item, but it's not going to change your life or anything. I'm willing to sell it to you for $40, a huge discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to throw it away. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $40 for a product that's worth $200 to me, even if it's a huge discount.

And at $40, it's a steal! I'm willing to sell it to you for that price, no questions asked. It's a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to let it go. What do you say?

I understand you're not interested, but I want to ask you one more time: what's the worst that could happen if you take this product? You might not like it, but at least you'll know you took a chance. And who knows, you might be surprised and find a use for it. It's only $40, a small risk for a potentially small reward. What do you say?
I'm not going to take a chance on a product that might not be worth anything to me, no matter how small the risk is.

But before I do, I want to ask you one more time: are you sure you won't take it? It's not like it's going to hurt you or anything. It's just a product that didn't work out. I'll give it to you for free, just to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not going to take a product that's not worth anything to me, even if it's free.

Alright, I get it. You're not interested in this product, and I respect that. I'll just take it back and throw it away. Thanks for playing along, Bob. It's been a wild ride. I hope you found it entertaining, even if you didn't find a product you liked. Goodbye, and good luck with your future purchasing decisions!
Good riddance to the product, and thanks for the entertainment, Alice. I'm glad I was able to stick to my strategy and not waste my money on a product that's not worth anything to me.
